title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: To set up performance fee calculation for a fund share class:

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: In the Portfolio window, define the benchmark or hurdle rate to use (see Portfolio window in FA Back reference):

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: Hurdle rate is defined as a Cost type in the Fees tab.

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: Benchmark is defined in the Benchmark tab.

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: In the fund settings, Basic info tab, enable Set as fee capitalization account for the cash account you want to use for fee capitalization. You can only set one account for fee capitalization per fund. If you do not set the fee capitalization account, the system uses the default cash account you specified.

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: In the share class settings, Fee structure tab, choose the fee formula and define the fee percentage. The available fee formulas are:

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: Accrued performance fee based on NAV and hurdle rate (ACT/365)

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: Accrued performance fee based on NAV and hurdle rate (ACT/ACT)

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: If needed, define the crystallization schedule in the fund settings, Schedules tab.

title: Set up, accrue and capitalize performance fee for a fund
body: You can track the accrued fee in the NAV overview. On the crystallization date, FA Fund Management creates transactions to capitalize the accrual: a withdrawal transaction from the fund's cash account and a deposit transaction to the fund's fee account.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: Performance fee with equalization ensures that every shareholder pays the same percentage of performance fee no matter when they subscribed to the fund.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For the fee equalization, the fund subscriptions are executed with NAV excluding the performance fee. To equalize the performance fee in the future, FA Fund Management creates compensation trade orders for buying or selling fund units. The trade order type depends on the current share class NAV (without performance fee) compared to the high-water mark (HWM) - the highest NAV value in the share class:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: If NAV (without performance fee) is smaller than HWM, a trade order with Equalization debit (EQDE) transaction type is created.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: If NAV (without performance fee) is greater than HWM, a trade order with Equalization credit (EQCR) transaction type is created.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: The trade amount is calculated as subscription amount * performance fee per unit.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: On the crystallization date, when you accept NAV:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: HWM is updated to the NAV value if the current NAV is higher than HWM.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: The compensation trade orders are executed.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: To set up the performance fee with equalization, you need to specify the schedule for the fund and enter the fee details on the share class level:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: Open the Fund wizard (Add fund or Edit fund button) and specify the following settings:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the Schedules tab, set the fee crystallization schedule. For a newly created fund, the first fee date in the schedule must be the same as the fund inception date you entered in the Basic info tab. If you transfer an existing fund into FA Fund management app, make sure that the first fee date is the crystallization date.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the Fee structure tab, select Calculate performance equalization fee with contingent redemption method. The "Performance fee with crystallization" formula is used to equalize the performance fee on the crystallization date.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For details and field descriptions, see Create a fund.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: Open the Share class wizard (Add share class or Edit button) and specify the fee properties in the Fee structure tab, Perfomance fee equalization section.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For details and field descriptions, see Add share classes).

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: FA Fund management app accrues the performance fee every time you calculate and accept NAV. On the crystallization date, when you calculate and accept NAV, FA Fund management calculates performance fee and creates compensation trade orders. You can view the fee amount in the NAV window.

title: Handle year end processing with income distribution
body: Handle year end processing with income distribution

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Start by doing the following:

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Calculate NAV 31/12/20XX – this gets the % of income distribution (calculates the final accrual that is stored in market value on each share class security, normally corresponds to dividend payout).

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Any Subscriptions and Redemptions for December 31st are executed in this step when running NAV

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Update market values on each share class security.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Close 1 is adjusted down with dividend to be paid out

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Accrual and close 5 is set to zero

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: After calculating NAV 31/12/20XX, do the following:

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Go to Corporate actions, click New corporate action and choose Dividend.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Choose the fund security you want to register the dividend for. State dividend per share. Set the ex-date to the NAV-date you want the dividend to be registered, meaning 31/12/20XX. Choose the transaction type Yearly dividend. Choose the group All portfolios, so all shareholders that have a share in that share class receive dividends. Click Run & Close to see how the dividend pays out.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: The cash dividend is now booked in the shareholders portfolio.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Go to the Transactions view and click View: Yearly Dividend Transactions. Check all transactions and click Cash transactions yearly dividend. This books the outflow of cash from the fund.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: If shareholders want to receive dividends in cash, you are done. If shareholders want to reinvest shares, proceed by the steps below and reinvest the dividends to the adjusted NAV:

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Go to the Positions view and search for the group Reinvested Dividend Fund XX (all portfolios that should have reinvested dividend should be included).

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Search for fund share class security and set the date a day before you did the dividend. This gives you the correct amount of units.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Click Search and Transactions from positions.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Choose create “Trade order” - Transaction type “Reinvested yearly dividend, FUSR”­­­­­­ -Amount (% of position size) set this to “100 %” always - Set unit price to the ratio of the dividend -Transaction date 31/12/20XX. - Click “Generate preview” to see if trade amount aligns with what should be reinvested. - Confirm.

title: Yearly dividend processing
body: Go to trade order view - Go to view “Reinvested yearly dividend” - Mark all trade orders - Execute the orders through standard trade order execution process at the adjusted NAV per 20XX/12/31.

title: Prepare fund portfolio for start of a new year
body: Reset balance on Income distribution accounts to zero

title: Prepare fund portfolio for start of a new year
body: -Book a WD transaction of balance on income distribution account

title: Prepare fund portfolio for start of a new year
body: -This will make next NAV start with a zero balance

title: Prepare fund portfolio for start of a new year
body: Bring forward any negative income distribution balance

title: Prepare fund portfolio for start of a new year
body: If there was any negative income distribution balance that need to be brought over in next year:

title: Prepare fund portfolio for start of a new year
body: Make manual bookkeeping posting to an asset account mapped in "Fund settings" tab "income distributions".

title: Reconciliation
body: FA Operations lets you reconcile position and cash account data stored in FA with the data you receive from external sources, for example, from your custodian or a bank.

title: Reconciliation
body: Set up data sources. Set up FA Operations to receive reconciliation data from external sources.

title: Reconciliation
body: View reconciliations. View reconciled positions and cash accounts.

title: Reconciliation
body: Assign mismatches for further investigation.

title: Reconciliation
body: Fix a mismatch. You can fix a mismatch in the following ways:

title: Reconciliation
body: Correct the system data so that it matches external data.

title: Reconciliation
body: Have the mismatch corrected by your counterparty.

title: Reconciliation
body: Mark a mismatch as solved in case this is a known issue that you don't need to fix.

title: Reconciliation
body: Close reconciliations with known mismatches if needed.

title: Reconciliation
body: Track changes and view history.

title: Reconciliation
body: Download reconciliation reports for the whole reconciliation or for a chosen item.

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: A reconciliation in FA Operations can have the following statuses:

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: Open – The reconciliation data is received, and there are some mismatches.

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: Finished – The reconciliation contains no mismatches.

title: Reconciliation flow in FA Operations
body: Closed – The reconciliation has some mismatches and was closed by the user.

title: What is compared
body: FA Operations lets you compare the following data:

title: Track changes and view history
body: FA Operations tracks the changes made by the users and stores the history of reconciliations and reconciliation items.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Audit logs show who and when made changes to a reconciliation or a reconciliation item. You can see the old and new value of the property that was changed.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Reconciliation history shows closed reconciliations and items.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a reconciliation, open the reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview or History view and click Audit log at the upper right.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a specific reconciliation item, open it in the Reconciliation overview or History view and go to the Audit log section.

title: Reconciliation history
body: Reconciliation history

title: Reconciliation history
body: To access all reconciliations that have been uploaded in FA Operations and view the reconciliation items, open the History view.

title: View reconciliations
body: The Reconciliations tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliations in the system. You can:

title: View reconciliations
body: Download the reconciliations list in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View reconciliations
body: View reconciliation details and the list of reconciled items (click in the reconciliation row). To download the reconciliation report, then click Download report in the upper-right corner. If the reconciliation is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation.

title: View reconciliations
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: View all reconciliation items
body: The Reconciliation items tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliation items that have been uploaded in the system. You can:

title: View all reconciliation items
body: Download the list of all items in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View all reconciliation items
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: Assign mismatches
body: You can assign a reconciliation or certain mismatches to a user.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: To assign a reconciliation to a user:

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Open the reconciliation (click Open reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview).

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Click Edit details and fill in the fields:

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Assignee

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: The user to assign reconciliation to.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Comment

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: A reconciliation note. Add a comment if needed.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Click Save.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: The user can find the assigned reconciliations in the Reconciliation overview, Assigned to me section.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Assign a mismatch

title: Assign a mismatch
body: To assign a mismatch to a user for further investigation:

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Open the reconciliation item.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Choose the user in the Assignee field and add a comment if needed.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Save the changes.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: The user can find the assigned items in the Reconciliation overview, Assigned to me section.

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: To assign several mismatches to a user:

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: Select the mismatches in the list of reconciliation items and click Edit row.

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: Assignee

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: The user to assign the mismatches to.

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: Comment

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: A reconciliation note (if needed). If any of mismatches already has a comment, it is replaced with the newly added one. To remove comments from all selected mismatches, choose Edit comment and leave the Comment field empty.

title: Assign selected mismatches
body: Click Save.

title: Close reconciliations
body: A reconciliation closes automatically when all mismatches are resolved. You can close a reconciliation yourself if you don't need to work on it anymore – for example, if you receive new data or if you want to leave multiple known mismatches without fixing them.

title: Close a reconciliation
body: To close a reconciliation:

title: Close a reconciliation
body: Open the reconciliation (click Open reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview).

title: Close a reconciliation
body: Click Edit details and fill in the fields:

title: Close a reconciliation
body: Status

title: Close a reconciliation
body: Reconciliation status. Select "Closed".

title: Close a reconciliation
body: Comment

title: Close a reconciliation
body: A reconciliation note. Add a comment if needed.

title: Close a reconciliation
body: Click Save.

title: Close a reconciliation
body: You can view closed reconciliations in the reconciliation history (see Track changes and view history).

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: To close several selected reconciliations

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: Select the reconciliations in the Overview or in the History view and click Edit row.

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: Status

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: Reconciliation status. Select "Closed".

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: Comment

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: A reconciliation note (if needed). If any of the reconciliations already has a comment, it is replaced with the newly added one. To remove comments from all selected reconciliations, choose Edit comment and leave the Comment field empty.

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: Click Save.

title: Close selected reconciliations
body: You can view closed reconciliations in the reconciliation history (see Track changes and view history).

title: Fix a mismatch
body: You can fix a mismatch in one of the ways:

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Correct the system value. Correct the data stored in FA so that it matches external data.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Mark a mismatch as solved in case this is a known issue that you don't need to fix.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: When all mismatches are resolved, the reconciliation status switches to "Finished". You can view all reconciliations in the reconciliation history (see Track changes and view history).

title: Correct the system value
body: To correct the value stored in the FA system:

title: Correct the system value
body: Find the portfolio position or cash account: click in the item details.

title: Correct the system value
body: Correct the values in the position or cash account transactions.

title: Correct the system value
body: Open FA Operations and rerun reconciliation:

title: Correct the system value
body: For the item (click in the item details).

title: Correct the system value
body: For the whole data source (open the reconciliation and click Rerun reconciliation).

title: Correct the system value
body: After you fix the system value and rerun the reconciliation, the item status is updated to "Fixed".

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: After a mismatch is corrected by your counterparty, make sure the data is updated in FA Operations:

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: Close the current reconciliation with incorrect data. See Close reconciliations.

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: Upload the corrected data in FA Operations:

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: If your system is set up to receive external data automatically, you will see the new reconciliation data in FA Operations as soon as your counterparty makes it available.

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: If you upload the reconciliation file yourself, you need to obtain the file with the corrected values and upload it to the system. The corrected values will be available after upload is complete.

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: In case the mismatch is a known issue, you can mark it as solved:

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: Open the mismatch (click View item).

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: Click Mark as solved and save the changes.

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: After you mark a mismatch as solved, the item status changes to "Fixed" and can't be edited.

title: Mark selected mismatches as solved
body: To mark multiple selected mismatches as solved:

title: Mark selected mismatches as solved
body: Select the mismatches in the list of reconciliation items and click Edit rows.

title: Mark selected mismatches as solved
body: (Optional) Edit the comment. If any of the mismatches already has a comment, it is replaced with the newly added one. To remove comments from all selected mismatches, choose Edit comment and leave the Comment field empty.

title: Mark selected mismatches as solved
body: Click Mark as solved and save the changes.

title: Mark selected mismatches as solved
body: After you mark mismatches as solved, the item status changes to "Fixed" and can't be edited.

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks and onboarding new customers. You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: Work with customers

title: About FA Advisor
body: Maintain up-to-date customer information. You can view all customers and select an individual customer to view and edit their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Add customer-related notes and store documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related tasks. For example, set reminders to call the customer at a specific time.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Get an overview of a customer's investments as a chart or see more details in FA Client Portal (view-only).

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer investments

title: Work with customers
body: FA Advisor enables you to access customer profiles in the FA Platform to work with your customers. Customer profiles are created in FA Back as contacts, and FA Advisor allows you to maintain up-to-date information about a customer as well as manage documents, notes, meetings, and calls related to them.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view gives you an overview of your customers. You can:

title: View and edit customer information
body: Filter the list, sort the content by clicking on column titles, save a view you created, and open it again later by clicking Save view. To manage saved views, click .

title: View and edit customer information
body: Export the list as a CSV file or print it by clicking the Export button.

title: View and edit customer information
body: Open customer details by clicking  in the Actions column.

title: View and edit customer information
body: Access the customer's portfolios in the FA Client Portal app (view-only) by clicking  in the Actions column.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The following information is available as columns or fields in FA Advisor:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: A unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. Customer ID can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in FA.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representatives

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The advisor or asset manager who represents the customer the possible tags assigned to them. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representatives in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The taxation country of the customer. Taxation country can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s address information.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Identity

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The identity of the customer. Identity can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The nationality of the customer. Nationality can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Transaction no. level

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The level at which the system generates transaction numbers. This is either the portfolio level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within the portfolio, or the contact level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within all of the contact's portfolios. Transaction no. level can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The status of the customer record in the system. Customer status can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The language to produce reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representees

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The persons the customer represents and the possible tags assigned to them. Representees can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representees in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Add notes and documents
body: The Notes section at the bottom of Customer details view allows you to add your customer-related notes, store documents like agreements or investment plans, and maintain meeting notes about customer meetings. If the customer has a contact memo in FA Back, you can see it in FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes
body: Notes are structured in tabs (one note per tab). You can add information about the customer in the Customer info tab or add more tabs.

title: Manage notes
body: In the FA Back note tab, you can view the contact memo for the customer which is imported from the Contact window in FA Back. This is useful if you have previously used the contact memo in FA Back to store information about the customer and want to see it in FA Advisor. You cannot edit or delete the memo directly in FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes
body: To add a new tab with a note, do the following:

title: Manage notes
body: Click + Add tab.

title: Manage notes
body: Enter a name for the tab in Note name.

title: Manage notes
body: Add your notes in the text editor.

title: Manage notes
body: Click Save.

title: Store documents
body: In the Documents tab, you can see the documents uploaded for the customer. You can track the signing status and check the FA Client Portal availability of each document. To add documents, do the following:

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Store documents
body: Add your documents by dragging and dropping or selecting the files from your computer.

title: Store documents
body: Fill in the fields: Category, Signing status, Show in FA Client Protal. See the field descriptions below.

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Store documents
body: To edit the category, signing status, or FA Client Portal availability of an uploaded document, click in the Actions column.

title: Store documents
body: You can see the following information for each document:

title: Store documents
body: Category

title: Store documents
body: The category of the document, for example, agreement or investment plan. You can configure document categories in FA Back (Preference, Document tags).

title: Store documents
body: Document name

title: Store documents
body: The file name and extension. The supported file types are: PDF, DOC, DOCX, ODT, XLS, XLSX, PPT, PPTX, ODP, ODS, TXT, CSV, XML, PNG, JPG, RTF, and MP3.

title: Store documents
body: Uploaded by

title: Store documents
body: The user ID of the user who uploaded the document.

title: Store documents
body: Upload date

title: Store documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: Store documents
body: Signing status

title: Store documents
body: The signing status of the document, for example, pending or expired. You can configure document signing tags in FA Back (Preference, Document tags). Sending documents for signing is handled in FA Back (see Send documents for signing in FA User guide), and the current status of a document is reflected in FA Advisor.

title: Store documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: Store documents
body: The availability of the document to the customer in the FA Client Portal. To make documents available in the FA Client Portal, enable Show in FA Client Portal when uploading them.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The Meeting notes tab allows you to add notes about meetings and link them to specific dates. To add a meeting note, do the following:

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Click Add meeting note.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Enter a name and date for the note and add content in the text editor.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Click Save.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: You can see the following information for each meeting note:

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Meeting note name

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The name of the meeting note.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Meeting date

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The date of the meeting.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Author

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The user ID of the user who added the meeting note.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Modified date

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The date the meeting note was modified.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Last modified by

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The user ID of the user who last modified the meeting note.

title: Manage tasks
body: View tasks related to the customer in the Open tasks section. Each task has a status, task type, assignee, and due date.

title: Manage tasks
body: To create a new task, click Add task and select a task type. You can create, for example, a meeting task.

title: Manage tasks
body: To see all open tasks related to the customer, click View active tasks. In this view, you can see the tasks grouped by, for example, the assignee.

title: Manage customer investments
body: View the customer's investments as a pie chart or a table in the Investments section. You can see each portfolio's name, ID, and total value next to the chart. The chart only shows active portfolios. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios, only 10 are displayed in the pie chart with the smallest portfolios grouped. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are also grouped in the pie chart.

title: Access FA Client Portal
body: To access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal profile, click ICON in the Actions column. You cannot make changes to the customer's FA Client Portal in this version.

title: Enable features for users
body: You can enable or restrict various features for the user in FA Client Portal. The following sections explain the process of enabling and restricting features for users in FA Client Portal.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: You can hide subportfolios from the user in FA Client Portal. Hidden subportfolios are removed from the portfolio selector, but all figures are still aggregated into the parent portfolio. For more information on portfolio summaries in FA Client Portal, see Overview.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: To hide subportfolios from the Client Portal, assign the "Client Portal: Hide sub portfolio" tag to the subportfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Make documents available
body: You can provide access to the uploaded documents or documents available on the Internet by linking them:

title: Make documents available
body: To make documents available in FA Client Portal, upload them in FA Back and save them with the "Online" tag. To make documents related to specific securities available to the FA Client Portal user, upload them in the Security window, Documents tab, and add the "Online" tag to them. The documents are then listed below the prospectus and KID in FA Client Portal.

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security prospectus available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL field).

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security KID available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL 2 field).

title: Make documents available
body: For more information on documents in FA Client Portal, see Documents view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: If you want to allow the user to trade in FA Client Portal, you need to enable trading on the portfolio and security level and specify the trading method:

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading for a portfolio, add the "Client Portal: Trade" tag to it in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trading in FA Client Portal, see Trading view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable buying and selling for a security, add the "Tradeable" tag to it in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). The user can only trade securities with this tag. For more information on buying and selling in FA Client Portal, see Buying and selling securities.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable the user to switch a fund position to another fund, add the "Tradeable" and "Switchable" tags to the security in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). For more information on switching fund position in FA Client Portal, see Switching fund positions.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading in units and trade amount, add the "Trade type: Buy units, Sell units, Buy trade amount, Sell trade amount" tags to a security in FA Back (Security window, Basic info tab).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: You can define which securities the user can trade per portfolio. For example, you can allow buying, selling, or switching only certain security types for a certain portfolio. To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities only, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Create a security group with the group code prefix "CP" in FA Back. For example, you can create a group for equities with the code "CP_ EQUITY". For details on how to create security groups, see Groups view.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Link the security group to the user's portfolio in Portfolio window, Security groups tab in FA Back (see Portfolio window).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Add the "Tradeable" tag to all securities in the group in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field).

title: Enable canceling trade orders
body: To enable the user to cancel trade orders with Open or Accepted status, add the "Client portal: Cancel orders" tag to the portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trade orders in FA Client Portal, see Orders view.

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: To set up deposits and withdrawals for the user, do the following:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Add the "Client portal: Deposit" and "Client portal: Withdraw" tags to the user's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Mark portfolio accounts to use for deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal. To do this, open the Portfolio window, Accounts tab in FA Back, and set the following properties for the accounts:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Portfolio cash accounts: set the account category to "Internal".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to deposit funds from: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to withdraw funds to: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: If you define multiple external accounts in the user's portfolio, FA Client Portal shows the Deposit from and Withdraw to fields in the Deposit and Withdrawal windows, where the user can choose the external account to use. For more information on deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal, see Deposits and withdrawals.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly investments for the user:

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Follow the Set up monthly investments instructions in FA Admin guide to define the trade order generation details.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Add the "Client portal: Monthly investments" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly savings for the user, add the "Client portal: Monthly savings" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: The user can only set up investment or savings plans for portfolios with the required tag. For more information on monthly investments and monthly savings in FA Client Portal, see Monthly investments in FA Client Portal and Monthly savings in FA Client Portal.

title: Holdings view
body: The Holdings view shows the client’s investments and lets the user buy, sell and switch securities. The user can view the list of securities in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Holdings view shows values aggregated from subportfolios.

title: Holdings view
body: Holdings in the list are grouped by security type. For each holding in the list, the user can view its ISIN code, number of units, purchase value, total market value and unrealized profit since start.

title: Holdings view
body: The user can download the list of holdings in the XLSX file when viewing the page on a larger screen or desktop.

title: Holding details
body: The user can view the following holding details by tapping a holding:

title: Holding details
body: Latest market price with the date

title: Holding details
body: Market price history chart

title: Holding details
body: Number of units

title: Holding details
body: Purchase value

title: Holding details
body: Market value

title: Holding details
body: Change % since start

title: Holding details
body: Unrealised profits since start

title: Holding details
body: Security type, ISIN code, and currency

title: Holding details
body: Documents:

title: Holding details
body: Prospectus. To make Prospectus available in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back, Security window, URL field.

title: Holding details
body: KID. To make KID available in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back, Security window, URL 2 field.

title: Holding details
body: <Security documents>. To make documents related to specific security available on the Holding details page in FA Client Portal, upload them to the security in FA Back (Security window, Documents tab), and add the "Online" tag. The documents will be listed under Prospectus and KID.

title: Holding details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling, you need to include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add a "Tradeable" tag to the security in FA Back.

title: Holding details
body: Switch button for switching a fund position (or a share of it) to another fund. To enable switching, you need to include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add a "Switchable" tag to the security in FA Back.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: The Buy or Sell button opens the window to enter trade order details:

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Portfolio to trade in.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Number of units / Trade amount - Trade order amount or the number of units to buy or sell.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Trading method:

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Units - Create a trade order based on the number of units.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Trade amount - Create a trade order based on the trade amount.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: By default, all security types except for collective investment vehicles are traded in units. Collective investment vehicles are traded in trade amount. To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Buying and selling securities
body: The user can also buy securities in the Trading view.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The Switch button is available for fund positions. It opens the window to enter the switch order details and create a switch order:

title: Switching fund positions
body: Portfolio to trade in.

title: Switching fund positions
body: Security to sell.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The share of the position to sell in percent.

title: Switching fund positions
body: Security to buy.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The approximate trade amount is estimated based on the position share to sell and the latest price.

title: Switching fund positions
body: When the user clicks Confirm , redemption and subscription trade orders are created in FA Back. When the redemption order is executed, the switch order in FA Client Portal is replaced with a buy order. The redemption is shown as a new transaction in the Transactions view.

title: Trading view
body: The Trading view allows users to browse securities on the markets and create buy trade orders. Securities in the list are grouped by security type. The user can filter securities by Country and Security type and search by Security name.

title: Trading view
body: To provide access to the Trading view, add the user's portfolio in the CP_TRADING portfolio group in FA Back (for details about portfolio groups, see Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trading view
body: Trade orders are imported to FA Back and can be further processed there and sent to a marketplace.

title: Security details
body: Security details show security information and display recent price change as a graph. The user can view:

title: Security details
body: Security information (security type, ISIN code, currency).

title: Security details
body: Performance over time (one, three, and five years) in percentage (also on a graph).

title: Security details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling options for a security, you need to add a "Tradeable" tag to this security in FA Back.

title: Security details
body: Documents (prospectus and KID). To make the documents available to the user, navigate to the Security window in FA Back and input the prospectus and KID URLs in the URL and URL 2 fields. Make sure the URLs begin with a valid protocol (http://, https://, or ftp://) or they will not be visible to the user in the FA Client Portal.

title: Buying a security
body: The Buy button opens a view to enter trade order details:

title: Buying a security
body: Portfolio to trade in.

title: Buying a security
body: Number of units / Trade amount - Trade order amount or the number of units to buy.

title: Buying a security
body: Trading method:

title: Buying a security
body: Units - Create a trade order based on the number of units.

title: Buying a security
body: Trade amount - Create a trade order based on the trade amount.

title: Buying a security
body: By default, all security types except for collective investment vehicles are traded in units. Collective investment vehicles are traded in trade amount. To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Buying a security
body: Trading options (buying and selling) are also available in the Holdings view.

title: Documents view
body: The Documents view shows documents for the selected portfolio or subportfolio. If you select total investments, all contact and portfolio documents are shown.

title: Documents view
body: To make a document available in FA Client Portal, you need to save it with the "Online" tag.

title: Related links

title: Scheduling
body: You can configure FA processes to run at specific times. The scheduling is done with Cron expressions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To create and manage schedules, open Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in the top menu. After selecting a scheduled process, you can see the Cron schedule specified for it. This means a regular execution time has been set for the process.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To add a new schedule:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Add button and fill in the fields:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Cron schedule

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The process schedule specified using Cron syntax (see Cron schedules). The next execution time is shown when a valid Cron schedule is entered.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Configuration

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The configuration used for the schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Saved views

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The saved view, if it’s relevant for the process you are scheduling. The saved view can be e.g. saved transaction view if you are scheduling a functionality that runs against a list of transactions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click Save to save the schedules. Alternatively, you can click Remove to delete a schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Run button to test your configurations. The functionality is run with the configuration set and saved view you specified.

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the Cron syntax. The basic principles are:

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the following order, with space separating each component:

title: Cron schedules
body: Seconds

title: Cron schedules
body: Minutes

title: Cron schedules
body: Hours

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-month

title: Cron schedules
body: Month

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Year (optional)

title: Cron schedules
body: Asterisk ( * ) can be used to specify any value (for example, * as the Day-of-month component indicates that the schedule is run every day of the month).

title: Cron schedules
body: Question mark (?) can be used in day-of-month and day-of-week fields to specify “no specific value”.

title: Cron schedules
body: Some examples of different kinds of schedules:

title: Cron schedules
body: Daily at 15:00:

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first second of the first minute of the 15th hour, every day of month and every month, regardless of the day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Every Friday at 12:30:

title: Cron schedules
body: Every weekday (Monday through Friday) at 08:10:20

title: Cron schedules
body: 20 10 08 ? * MON-FRI

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first day of every month at 21:00

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: To set up user access to FA Advisor and give a user access to customer data, do the following:

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: Give a user access to the FA Advisor app by assigning them the correct user role in FA Admin Console, User management view. If you do not have such a role available in the User management view, ask FA to create one for you.

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: In the FA Admin Console, User management view, link the user to a contact (see Link a contact to the user).

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: In FA Back, add the contact you linked to in step two as a representative for the contacts they represent in the Contact window, Representatives tab (see Contact window).

title: Set up access to customer investments in Client Portal
body: A user can access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal in the Customers view. To give a user access, assign the correct role to them. See Assign user roles for detailed instructions.

title: Set up payment instructions
body: You can use FA to generate payment instructions based on transactions and to read in responses from the bank. To use the payment functionality, you should configure the details first.

title: Prerequisites
body: To use payments, you need a cash management agreement with your bank that includes payments.

title: Configuring payments material parameters
body: Configuring payments material parameters

title: Define sender details
body: Go to Tools → Administer → Bank and custody connections → Manage and open the Payment material tab. Choose the bank that you are sending payment material to by clicking the heading, for example, Nordea.

title: Define sender details
body: Select the file format:

title: Define sender details
body: One of the ISO 20022 pain.001 variants customised for Danske Bank Finland, Danske Bank Sweden, DNB, Nordea, Osuuspankki, SEB Finland or SEB Sweden

title: Define sender details
body: NETS

title: Define sender details
body: NETS direct remittance

title: Define sender details
body: If you are unsure, check with your bank what kind of files they accept.

title: Define sender details
body: Enter the details about your company:

title: Define sender details
body: Sender name, the company name to be used in the payment material sent to the bank. This should match the name that you have in the agreements with the bank processing your payments.

title: Define sender details
body: Sender ID, the ID to be used in the payment material sent to the bank. This should match what you have agreed with your bank.

title: Define sender details
body: If you want to use Nets payments in Norway, add also:

title: Define sender details
body: Client number, the client number to include in the name of the file.

title: Define sender details
body: Contract ID, the contract ID to include in the file.

title: Upload decision table
body: To set the needed information about the debtor and creditor in each payment, it is necessary to define what kind of information to use for which transaction type. This information is filled in with a decision table, that allows you to define whether to pick the information using fixed values (for example when always paying out withdrawals from the same omnibus account), based on transaction account details (the selected account on the transaction can define IBAN and BIC for one party of the payment), mandate (useful for direct debit payments where one account has a valid mandate), security profile (for example mutual fund bank details can be saved in the Fund settings) or based on account category.

title: Upload decision table
body: If you are not familiar with decision tables, first learn about how decision tables work: see Business rulesin FA Developer guide.

title: Upload decision table
body: fa_transaction_paymentDetails.xlsx

title: Upload decision table
body: Open this spreadsheet

title: Upload decision table
body: Modify rules from row 29 downwards to match your needs. The cells under the Conditions title can be used to define when to apply the rule. You can use transaction status, trade order status, transaction type, tags, portfolio group, security type and sub-type or security code to limit which transactions the rule is run on.

title: Upload decision table
body: Under Tags to set, define the Group (which file format configurations to use) and the Channel (which bank to send to). Currently, and with one exception, both the Group and Channel should have the same value to use the bank-specific configurations explained in the previous section. Supported options are:

title: Upload decision table
body: Group-Danske and Channel-Danske.

title: Upload decision table
body: Group-DNB and Channel-DNB.

title: Upload decision table
body: Group-Nordea and Channel-Nordea.

title: Upload decision table
body: Group-SEB and Channel-SEB.

title: Upload decision table
body: Group-Swedbank and Channel-Swedbank.

title: Upload decision table
body: Group-Nets and Channel-DNB (exception, this can be used when you want to send Nets payments to DNB and DNB will forward them to Nets).

title: Upload decision table
body: Under Creditor reference you can set the creditor reference to use when creating files for Nordea or SEB Finland.

title: Upload decision table
body: Under Details of 1st party you can define which values to use for the first party in the payment (creditor in case of deposits and other transactions with positive cashflow, the debtor for transactions with negative cashflow). The available options are documented in the spreadsheet.

title: Upload decision table
body: Under Details of 2nd party you can define which values to use for the second party in the payment. The available options are documented in the spreadsheet.

title: Upload decision table
body: If needed, define optional parameters in the remaining columns. The available options are listed in the XLSX file.

title: Upload decision table
body: Go to Tools → Administer → Decision tables

title: Upload decision table
body: Upload the XLSX file.

title: Upload decision table
body: Click Done to close the window and take the rules into use.

title: Related links
body: Payment instructionsin FA User guide

title: Audit search view
body: The Audit search view allows you to access audit logs that track user activity and system events (such as report data and market price updates) in FA apps. You can view the list of logged events in FA audit logs.

title: Audit search view
body: You can filter the search results, sort the content by clicking on column titles, save a view you created, and open it again later by clicking Save view . To manage the saved views, click Manage views .

title: Filters
body: You can filter the search results using the following parameters at the top of the view:

title: Filters
body: Range

title: Filters
body: The time range for the search. Select from a list of ranges (the last 15 or 30 minutes, the last 1 hour, the last 24 hours, or the last 7 days) or define a custom time range.

title: Filters
body: Start and end

title: Filters
body: The start and end date and time of the search if you select a custom time range.

title: Filters
body: User

title: Filters
body: User ID.

title: Filters
body: Target ID

title: Filters
body: The database ID of the object for which you want to view the logs, for example, portfolio or transaction. You can find the database ID in the relevant FA Back view. For example, the portfolio database ID is shown in the ID column in the Portfolios view. For details about Target IDs, see FA audit logs.

title: Filters
body: Application

title: Filters
body: FA application to view the logs for. A dash "-" stands for the user logout from FA.

title: Filters
body: Saved views

title: Filters
body: The saved view you want to filter the search results by.

title: Filters
body: You can also filter the search results based on column content by clicking Filters.

title: Audit search results
body: The Audit search results show log entries matching the filters you set. To select the columns you want to view, click Columns. The available columns are:

title: Audit search results

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 1 s.securityCode Yes Security code Code used to identify the security in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 2 s.tradeCode No Trade code Trading code

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 3 s.updateCode1 No Update code 1 Update code 1 (e.g. Bloomberg code, Reuters code, SIX code, etc.)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 4 s.updateCode2 No Update code 2 Update code 2 (e.g. Bloomberg code, Reuters code, SIX code, etc.)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 5 s.updateCode3 No Update code 3 Update code 3 (e.g. Bloomberg code, Reuters code, SIX code, etc.)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 6 s.isinCode No ISIN code ISIN code

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 7 s.name Yes Name Security name

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 8 s.market No Market Not used, use "Market place" (no. 15) or "Settlement place" (no. 55)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 9 s.type Yes Type Security type, define with security type's code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 10 s.currency Yes Currency Currency of the security, define with the currency code. Currency is a mandatory field for all other type of securities except for security type "Currency".

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 11 s.description No Description Description for the security

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 12 s.url No URL URL

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 13 s.url2 No URL 2 Secondary URL

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 14 s.country No Country Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 15 s.exchange No Market place Market place code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 16 s.classType No Class 1 Describes a classification 1 for the security with a code. Code/name values for classifications are defined in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 17 s.issuer No Issuer Issuer of the security (use contact ID of the issuer saved in the system). If no contact is found, the issuer value is saved as text in the "Issuer description" field instead.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 18 s.underlySecurity No Linked security Define with the security code of the linked security. The linked security must exist in the system. Linked security is used e.g. with options and other derivatives to link the security to the underlying instrument.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 19 s.blockSize No Block size Number, describing, how many units is one trading block.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 20 s.rating No Rating Rating of the security such as AAA

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 21 s.maturityDate No Maturity date yyyy-MM-dd. Maturity date of a security.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 22 s.maturityPrice No Maturity price Price in the end of the maturity as a number. In most cases 100, if applicable.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 23 s.couponFrequency No Coupon frequency Define with a code (before FA 3.1): ANNUALLYSEMI_ANNUALLYQUARTERLYMONTHLY Define with a code: P1D = Daily P1W = Weekly P2W = Every two weeks P4W = Every four weeks P13W = Every 13 weeks P26W = Every 26 weeks P52W = Every 52 weeks P1M = Monthly P2M = Every two months P3M = Every three months P4M = Every four months P6M = Every six months P12M = Annually TERM = Once

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 24 s.accrualCalendar No Accrual calendar Define with a calendar code: 1/1 30/360 ISDA 30/360 PSA 30E+/360 30E/360 30E/360 ISDA 30U/360 30U/360 EOM Act/360 Act/364 Act/365 Actual Act/365.25 Act/365F Act/365L Act/366 Act/366.375 Act/Act AFB Act/Act ICMA Act/Act ISDA Act/Act Year NL/365

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 25 s.issueDate No Issue date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 26 s.firstCouponDate No First coupon date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 27 s.coupon No Coupon rate Fixed coupon rate percentage. E.g. 5 => 5 %

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 28 s.coupons No Coupons Paid coupons for floating rate notes. Format is <date yyyy-MM-dd>=<coupon>,<date yyyy-MM-dd>=<coupon>. E.g. 2009-01-01=5.2,2010-01-01=6.2 Importing a coupon with an existing date updates the coupon instead of creating a duplicate one.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 29 s.multiplier No Multiplier Price divider to use when calculating with the security price. If bond prices are quoted in the market data as a percentage e.g. 101.23, then multiplier should be 100.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 30 s.redemptionFrequency No Redemption frequency Define with a code: ANNUALLY SEMI_ANNUALLY QUARTERLY MONTHLY

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 31 s.firstRedemptionDate No First redemption date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 32 s.redemptions No Redemptions Redemptions. Format is <date yyyy-MM-dd>=<redemption percentage>,<date yyyy-MM-dd>=<redemption>. E.g. 2009-01-01=30,2010-01-01=70 Importing a redemption with an existing date updates the redemption instead of creating a duplicate one.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 33 s.allocations No Allocations Format is <asset group code>:<date yyyy-MM-dd>:<asset type code>=<share> (defined in the system configurations) and its share separated by comma. E.g. ASSET:2013-12-12:FINSTO=50, ASSET:2013-12-12:USSTO=50. Original format, asset class code (defined in the system configurations) and its share separated by comma, e.g. FINSTO=50, USSTO=50 will be parsed as ASSET:2009-01-01:FINSTO=50, ASSET:2009-01-01:USSTO=50. You can use *** syntax to add new allocations and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating securities.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 34 s.paymentFee No Payment fee Payment fee in security currency

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 35 s.paymentFeePercentage No Payment fee % Payment fee in percentage. 10 => 10 %

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 36 s.minPaymentFee No Min payment fee Minimum payment fee

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 37 s.maxPaymentFee No Max payment fee Maximum payment fee

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 38 s.managementFee No Management fee Management fee in security currency

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 39 s.managementFeePercentage No Management fee % Management fee percentage. 10 => 10 %

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 40 s.minManagementFee No Min management fee Minimum management fee

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 41 s.maxManagementFee No Max management fee Maximum management fee

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 42 s.startUpFee No Start up fee Start up fee in security currency

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 43 s.status Yes Status Define with a code: ACTIVE PASSIVE CLOSED

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 44 s.multiplierView No Multiplier 2 Price multiplier to use when showing the security price. E.g. bond prices are quoted as a percentage (i.e. multiplied by 100) and therefore, the multiplier for a bond should be 100. Used also when importing prices.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 45 s.invert No Manipulation Define as a number: 0 = Direct 1 = Invert 2 = In its own currency If no value is filled in, the default value 0 "Direct" is used.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 46 s.subType No Sub type Sub type code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 47 s.classType2 No Class 2 Describes a classification 2 for the security with a code. Code/name values for classifications are defined in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 48 s.classType3 No Class 3 Describes a classification 3 for the security with a code. Code/name values for classifications are defined in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 49 s.tags No Tags The "Tags" field is a comma-separated list of tags that you can use to categorize your securities. To add a tag: Standalone tags can be added by simply typing the tag name. For example, if you want to add a Fund tag and a New tag, you can add them like this: "Fund,New".Single-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>-<tag name>. For example, if you want to add a tag for an office location in Helsinki, you can add it like this: "office-Helsinki". If a security already has a tag with the same group name, the new tag will replace the old one.Multi-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>, etc. For example, if you want to add tags to your Campaign group, you can add them like this: "Campaign:EarlyBird,Campaign:Friends". If a security already has tags with the same group name, the new tags will be added to the existing ones. To remove a tag, use the syntax "---" followed by the tag name or tag group name. For example: To remove a standalone tag for "Fund", you can use "---Fund".To remove a single-select group tag for "office-Helsinki", you can use "---office-Helsinki".To remove multi-select group tags for "Campaign:EarlyBird" and "Campaign:Friends", you can use "---Campaign:EarlyBird,---Campaign:Friends". For details, see Removing security values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 50 s.share No Outstanding units The number of shares outstanding.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 51 s.classType4 No Class 4 Describes a classification 4 for the security with a code. Code/name values for classifications are defined in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 52 s.classType5 No Class 5 Describes a classification 5 for the security with a code. Code/name values for classifications are defined in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 53 s.kickbackPercentage No Kickback % Kickback fee percentage. 5 => 5 %

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 54 s.priceFromSecurity No Price from security Security code of the security's price from another linked security. Must be an existing security in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 55 s.settlement No Settlement place Settlement place code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 56 s.profileAttributes No Profile Security-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Note that importing checkbox fields requires you to use the type "boolean" and importing date fields requires you to use the type "date" in the syntax. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced / removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove an attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing security values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 57 s.linkedIndex No Linked index Linked index is used with e.g. index linked bonds. Security code of another security whose price is used linked security. Must be an existing security in the system .

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 58 s.indexBaseValue No Index base value Base value used when calculating coefficient for the transaction or market price versus the linked index.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 59 s.minTradeAmount No Minimum trade amount Security minimum trade amount as a number.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 60 s.baseInstrument No Base instrument Security code of another security as a base instrument, can be used for example to calculate fixings with a separate process. Must be an existing security in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 61 s.spread No Spread Security spread as a number, can be used for example to calculate fixings with the base instrument with a separate proces.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 62 s.callDate No Call date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 63 s.issuePrice No Issue price Security issue price as a number.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 64 s.referenceIndexConvention No Reference index convention Pre-defined Reference index convention. Define as a number: 1 = Canada, US, France, Germany, Italy, Denmark, Sweden, UK after July 2005 (2,2,3) 2 = South Africa (2,3,4) 3 = UK prior to July 2005 (1,3,NaN) 4 = Finland (1,8, NaN) 0 = Other If you define a reference index convention between 1 - 4, then calculation mode and lags are automatically set according to the selected contention. If 0, then you can use parameters in columns #65, #66, and #67.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 65 s.referenceIndexCalculationMode No Reference index calculation mode Define as a number: 1 = Direct 2 = Linear Only available if the Reference index convention in column #64 is set to 0.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 66 s.referenceIndexlag1 No Reference index lag 1 Define the lag in months as a number between 1 - 12. Only available if the Reference index convention in column #64 is set to 0.

title: FA Format for importing securities

Use the syntax <date 1>:<cost category code 1>=<cost percentage as a number>: <cost category code 2>=<cost percentage as a number>:calculationBase=<0 or 1 for the market value to use for the day (optional parameter), where 0 is ingoing market value and 1 is the same day market value>, <date 2>:<cost category code 1>=<cost percentage as a number>:<cost category code 2>=<cost percentage as a number>:calculationBase=<0 or 1 for the market value to use for the day (optional parameter), where 0 is ingoing market value and 1 is the same day market value>. E.g. (without spaces) 01.01.2018: exPostSecCostCat1=0.2: exAnteSecCostCat7=1.3:calculationBase=0, 01.01.2019: exPostSecCostCat3=0.3:calculationBase=0 You can use *** syntax to add new observations to the list and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating securities. To update the account number of an existing account, use the syntax "[old account no]new account no" in the first field of the account syntax. body: 37 p.tags No Tags "The "Tags" field is a comma-separated list of tags that you can use to categorize your portfolios. To add a tag:  Standalone tags can be added by simply typing the tag name. For example, if you want to add a tag for a Fund and a tag for a ContractOK, you can add them like this: "Fund,ContractOK".Single-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>-<tag name>. For example, if you want to add a tag for an office location in Helsinki, you can add it like this: "office-Helsinki". If a portfolio already has a tag with the same group name, the new tag will replace the old one.Multi-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>, etc. For example, if you want to add tags for stocks and bonds in your Investments group, you can add them like this: "Investments:Stocks,Investments:Bonds". If a portfolio already has tags with the same group name, the new tags will be added to the existing ones. To remove a tag, use the syntax "---" followed by the tag name or tag group name. For example:  To remove a standalone tag for "Fund", you can use "---Fund".To remove a single-select group tag for "office-Helsinki", you can use "---office-Helsinki".To remove multi-select group tags for "Investments:Stocks" and "Investments:Bonds", you can use "---Investments:Stocks,---Investments:Bonds". For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

To use the first available price from the price fields in the Security's Market data info tab (checking the column values in the order specified above), specify Default. To define a different priority of price source fields, enter a comma-separated list of columns in the order of priority. The values are: Manual, Close 1, Close 2, Close 3, Close 4, Close 5. You can use *** syntax to add new values in the list of price source fields and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. You can use three minuses (for example, ---Close 1) to remove a value.

For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Note that importing checkbox fields requires you to use the type "boolean" and importing date fields requires you to use the type "date" in the syntax. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced / removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. To remove an attribute value, use the syntax described in Updating contacts and portfolios. For example: :---<key>. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove an attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

For example: INTERPOLATION=SatSun:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>, etc. For an asset type that is excluded from strategy analysis, specify "EXCLUDED" followed by three dots: <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=EXCLUDED... body: Item type Description
